resources.string: Espresso poured on a vanilla ice cream. Served in a cappuccino cup.

Espresso with added hot water (100-150 ml). Often served in a cappuccino cup. (The espresso is added into the hot water rather than all the water being flowed through the coffee that would lead to over extraction.)
A tall, mild \'milk coffee\' (about 150-300 ml). An espresso with steamed milk and only a little milk foam poured over it. Serve in a latte glass or a coffee cup. Flavored syrup can be added.
A classic Italian coffee drink that is traditionally equal parts espresso, steamed milk, and milk foam. Served in a cappuccino cup. Often enjoyed with a sprinkle of cocoa powder or cinnamon.
A rich, chocolate-flavored coffee drink. Typically made with espresso, steamed milk, and chocolate syrup, topped with whipped cream. Served in a large coffee cup.

A chocolate-flavored variant of a caffe latte, combining espresso, steamed milk, and chocolate syrup or powder. Often topped with whipped cream and a dusting of cocoa powder. Served in a large coffee cup.
